title: Wholetime Firefighter
description:
Job Title: Wholetime Apprentice FirefighterContract: PermanentWorking Hours: 42 hours a week*Salary: £27,178.00 rising to £36,226 when CompetentLocation: All of EssexClosing Date: 29th February 2024The Role (Role Profile)We’re recruiting wholetime firefighters to begin training in August 2024. Forget those outdated stereotypes. We’re team members, teachers, communicators, community-minded, protectors and role models – firefighting is a diverse and rewarding career on the front line, saving lives. If you want to play a key role in our communities, preventing and protecting our residents and visitors from harm and keeping Essex safe, this is the role for you.What you need to know before applying for our August 2024 squad• If you are successful, you’ll attend a non-residential 17-week training course at our Service Training Centre in Witham, Essex. The hours will be 8.30am - 5pm, Monday to Friday, starting on 27 August 2024, with induction days on either 22 or 23 August 2024.• You will not be able to take leave during this period due to the intensive requirements and safety critical nature of the training.• The working pattern after successful completion of the 17-week training course will be two days 9am-6pm followed by two nights 6pm-9am, with four days off, on a rolling pattern.Our wholetime firefighters complete a Level 3 Operational Firefighting Apprenticeship alongside their standard firefighter training. Being able to offer all of our new firefighters an apprenticeship qualification means we’re able to invest in our leaders of tomorrow. This is a nationally recognised qualification and will be a condition of the offer. For details please see: Operational Firefighter Level 3 Apprenticeship - Colchester Institute. Operational Firefighter Level 3 Apprenticeship - Colchester Institute. Further information will be provided during the application process.About youFirefighters come in all ages, shapes and sizes and we know the best teams are made up of different kinds of people, which is why we’re interested in hearing from anyone who meets our eligibility requirements. You don’t need any previous experience of firefighting, you just need to be community-minded and share our vision of making Essex a safe place to live, work and travel. We’ll give you all the training you need to become a first-class firefighter. You will live and breathe our Service values of being professional, courageous, open and honest. You will be naturally inclusive and value the contribution of all and be committed to the value of working as one team.About usECFRS is one of the largest fire and rescue services in the country, serving a county with a wide variety of risks. Essex is home to two airports, Stansted and Southend, as well as Harwich seaport, Lakeside shopping centre, power stations, docks at Tilbury and, along the Thames, several underground stations, and parts of the M25 and M11 motorways and several significant A-roads, and areas of diverse and complex risk.We have 50 fire stations across the County – 12 of which are wholetime, and we employ nearly 400 wholetime firefighters as part of an organisation of over 1400 people across operations, Service Control, and support staff.Eligibility (Person Specification)To be eligible to apply for these opportunities, you must: • Have GCSE A*-C (9-4) or Functional Skills Level 2 in Maths and English.• Hold a full manual UK Driving Licence• Be able to travel to any fire station in Essex• Eligible to work in the UK• Have a valid email address• Meet the vision criteria reference in the FAQ's Entry RequirementsHow to applyPlease apply via our recruitment portal.Assessment and selection:The assessment and selection approach will be:Stage 1Online application formStage 2Psychometric online assessments - this stage is an important part of our selection process and will help us shortlist candidates for the next stage.Stage 3If you have been shortlisted following the psychometric assessment, you will be invited to aphysical assessment day. Please go to our Firefighter fitness page for more information.Stage 4On successful completion of the assessment day, you will be invited to an interview based on our service Values, the national Code of Ethics for firefighters and the NFCC Leadership Framework.Stage 5Those of you who have demonstrated you have the values, traits, behaviours and fitness to have progressed this far will be invited to attend our Service Training Centre for a series of practical and team working activities which will form the final assessment.You will also be required to undertake a fitness validation.Our Culture and BenefitsHere at Essex County Fire and Rescue Service we are committed to prioritising and promoting the wellbeing of our employees. You can find out more about our benefits at https://www.essex-fire.gov.uk/recruitment/benefitsDisability ConfidentWe are an equal opportunities, Disability Confident, employer who welcomes applications from everyone and values diversity in our workplace. A commitment to promoting diversity and developing a work environment where all staff are treated with dignity and respect is central to our recruitment process and all applications will be considered solely on merit.This role will be subject to an Enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check.

To fulfil this duty and keep the communities of South Wales Safe, we work together with colleagues from other frontline services and agencies. We employ crews of Wholetime Firefighters at twenty-one Fire Stations within Bridgend, Rhondda Cynon Taf, Vale of Glamorgan, Caerphilly, Merthyr Tydfil, Blaenau Gwent, Torfaen, Newport, and Cardiff. Firefighters communicate with different community groups, particularly vulnerable adults, the elderly, and children. Our preventative work takes us into people’s homes to conduct Safe and Well visits and install fire detection devices. We also attend schools and community venues to deliver talks, demonstrations and presentations educating children and the general public on safety. The Selection process for shortlisted applicants will include Ability Tests, Physical and Practical Assessments and Interviews. If you have any enquiries, you are invited to contact our dedicated Wholetime Firefighter recruitment team by emailing: wds@southwales-fire.gov.uk All documentation is available in both Welsh and English and we welcome communication in either language. description:
Are you looking for an exciting and rewarding career that combines civilian and military firefighting? Do you have the courage, skills and commitment to serve the Royal Air Force and the nation? If so, you might be interested in this opportunity to become a Sponsored Reserve Firefighter.We are currently hiring for multiple positions across various locations. Please note that the start dates for these positions are dependent on successful completion of various assessments and course availability at the Fire Service College. As a result, the application process can take several months to complete.Sponsored Reserves are crucial in providing Defence with a mission-critical service which enables the military to operate in the UK, overseas and on operations.What you'll be doing:
• You'll be part of the RAF Firefighter force which provides the Aerodrome & Rescue Firefighting capability to Defence across the UK and overseas.• You'll be ready to respond to and fight fires in the UK, as well as rescue from military aircraft.• You'll provide a first response to emergencies on the Defence estate and assist in providing fire safety awareness to Station personnel.• When deployed in the UK and overseas, you'll be required to support operations and exercises in potentially challenging environments.• You'll be trained to use highly specialised vehicles and equipment.• Daily tasks will include ensuring that specialised vehicles and equipment are tested and inspected whilst also maintaining and honing your professional firefighter skills.
What we're looking for:
• You must be a citizen of the UK or Republic of Ireland, holder of a dual UK/other nationality passport, or have been a Commonwealth citizen from birth. You should have resided in the UK for 5 years immediately preceding your application (candidates with a minimum of 3 years will be considered).• Have a minimum of Grade C or 4 to 5 in GCSE English Language and Mathematics, or SCE Standard Grade 3 in English and Maths or equivalent.• You'll need to have a current full driving license.• You'll need to be fit enough to complete initial and specialist training and perform your role effectively. Fitness tests include Selection Fitness Test, and Pre-Joining Fitness Test or Pre-recruit Training Course - the requirements for these tests vary according to role, age, and gender.• Health requirements must be met by all applicants (Body Mass Index, eyesight, and medical conditions that may preclude entry into the RAF reserves) - disqualifying factors are considered.• You'll need to be prepared to undertake and pass Situational and Behavioural tests during the recruitment phase and complete all background checks.
About Capita Fire & Rescue (CFR):Here at Capita, we're changing the future of firefighting and creating a world class Fire and Rescue Service with the UK Ministry of Defence.Through transformation, innovation and expertise, CFR is a high-performing fire and rescue service which enhances the safety of firefighters and customers and protects their critical assets.What's in it for you:The salary for this position is £27,650 per annum, increasing to £31,106 per annum once fully trained. You will also receive a £7,000 remuneration package each time you deploy, plus a £1,500 Operational Training Supplement (if you achieve the required annual training obligation as specified for the RAF). In addition, you will enjoy benefits such as:
• A full training programme to ensure you can do your job safely and to the best of your ability.• 23 days holiday with the opportunity to buy extra leave, a company matched pension, life assurance, Cycle2Work scheme, 15 weeks' fully paid maternity, adoption and shared parental leave, and many more benefits.• Access to all Capita's Employee Network Groups (ENGs) covering all aspects of diversity and inclusion.

title: Secretary
description: Duties Typing referral letters, xray requests, investigation requests in a timely manner. Provide full secretarial support to GPs, Practice Manager and other colleagues as appropriate. Typing memos, reports, bank reconciliations as instructed by the practice manager. Collating referral activity and process referrals using internal and RSO, VBC system software. Making appointments for patients within secondary care on a face to face basis and via telephone ensuring that referral data is entered onto the EMIS clinical record and using internal procedures and Ereferral. Ensure that the environment is conducive to good practice and promotes a caring image. Ensuring patients follow up booked appointments by managing Ereferral worklists as directed. Offering choice to patients and providing them with information on hospital parking, waiting lists, infection rates etc if appropriate. Hand over messages to clinicians when necessary. Keeping practice manager informed of workload demand. Maintaining records of VBC tickets and referrals. Dealing with patient queries regarding referrals, investigations. Ensuring a calm ambience is present at all times. Dealing with requests for copies of medical records made in person or by post or e-mail. Ensuring consent is available prior to sending and payment received. Recording cheque payments and patient details. Collection of patient demographics at every contact name, address and telephone number on computer. Always reassure the patient with a positive response and take telephone number and confirm address prior to dealing with appointment booking or query. Clearing secretaries out trays Chasing up hospital appointments where appropriate. Maintaining confidentiality at all times. Informing patients of funding panel decisions etc following practice procedures. Read coding of medical forms completed and sent etc. Answering telephone queries and redirecting calls to doctors, practice manager, nurses, and health visitors where appropriate. Taking and recording of messages using message sheets provided for doctors, practice manager, nurses, health visitors and midwives. Be the link between patient and secondary care. Contact patients with messages as directed in a professional manner. Ensure your work area meets Health & Safety requirements and report any accident or untoward incident to the appropriate person. Undertake practice shopping list in line with rota. Ensure records are put back to file as quickly as possible and do not keep notes out of file unless necessary. Ensure that medical record information such as change of address or telephone numbers are recorded as soon as they are received on electronic record. Prepare spreadsheets if trained as requested by practice manager. Qualified, skilled team members may be asked to produce memos and other documentation. Respond to the needs of patients, colleagues and employers in the daily function of the practice. Log complaints and compliments in appropriate book. Send faxes as directed Attending team meetings (time in lieu shall be given if outside normal working hours. Chaperoning doctors undertaking examinations if trained. Ordering stationery and computer supplies and consumables as requested. Ordering of dictation equipment via the appropriate channels. Any administrative duties requested by the practice manager. Logging of computer prescriptions in and out of storage. Undertake duties from time to time to ensure the smooth running of the admin office and reception. SARS request copies of patient records. Any other duties.
